newsitem.title: JAPAN: Rikadenki ask-only in Tokyo on financial woes.
newsitem.headline: Rikadenki ask-only in Tokyo on financial woes.

text.p: Shares in Japan's Rikadenki Kogyo Co Ltd were ask-only on Monday morning after it said last week that banks are likely to suspend its right to make fresh transactions as of March 5.
As of 0126 GMT, shares in the measuring instrument maker were ask-only at 175 yen. The shares were last traded at 365 yen on Wednesday.

The company said in a statement on Friday that banks were likely to suspend its right to engage in fresh transactions as of March 5 because of its failure to honour promissory notes for a second time. The company said that it had not decided whether to continue its business or to restructure, but added that it would make public its decision soon.

The Rikadenki shares, traded on the over-the-counter market, are likely to be put under surveillance on March 5, when banks actually take such a step, an official of the Japan Securities Dealers' Association said on Monday.

Rikadenki said it had suffered from falling prices for its mainstay industrial measuring products in the face of tough competition from domestic rivals. It has posted a current loss for eight successive years, it said.
